Titles CHALKDUST
Type: Lecture Documentary
Time: 15:00
No*: 10 programs to finish series
Origin: WSUI
Audience: Adult
Serial Number: 56-42
Release Date: January 6, 1957
A frank, informal series of talks to parents and teachers about how today s public
schools children are being taught, with actual and simulated class and home
situations. Designed to promote understanding of advancements in today1s teaching
methods, these talks are middle of the road but generally pro the modern public
school.
The authorities for these talks are: David K. Stewart, Director of Elementary
Education, Iowa City Public Schools, and Frank Snider, Superintendent of Schools,
Johnson County, Iowa* The regular speaker is Mr* Stewartj occasional performers
are Miss Argus Youngblade, third grade teacher, and elementary grade school
children.
When originally offered, this series was announced as being for 13 weeks. Now,
thanks to WSUI, we are able to bring you ten additional weeks of CHALKDUST.
Descriptive material for programs 11 through 23 is not available as yet, but we
will get it to you as soon as possible.
